medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Three weeks prior to admission, the patient experienced subjective fever, intermittent shaking chills, fatigue, malaise, anorexia, and mild diffuse myalgias. He reduced his fluid intake and noted darkening of urine. Symptoms were temporarily relieved with acetaminophen. Ten days before admission, laboratory tests indicated serum creatinine level rising from 0.8 mg/dL to 4.9 mg/dL.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Impaired glucose tolerance, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, abdominal aortic aneurysm, eczema, benign colonic polyps, diverticulosis, osteoarthritis of the knees, shoulders, and lumbar spine. Underwent right inguinal hernia repair and radical prostatectomy for prostate cancer 16 years previously.
medical_history.family_history: Father had lung cancer; mother had diabetes. No family history of autoimmune or renal disease.
medical_history.social_history: Retired from a sales job involving travel to Europe and Mexico; consumed 3 to 4 beers daily since retirement; smoked half a pack of cigarettes daily for 50 years, now smoking a few per day.
